alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 11:06PM EST until February 05 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia... Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Rock Ford Road begins to flood in multiple locations, including flowing completely over the low water bridge. Constant Run Road and a small portion of Kilgore Road also begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.1 feet, or 1.9 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 03/01/1929. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sat Sat Sat Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapon 9.0 7.1 Fri 10 pm 5.1 3.9 3.6 9.0 1am Sat &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 900 AM EST.
